data.description: I was walking to my appartement at 4 am. I just went partying with my friends.  I was quite tipsy. The night was warm so I wasn\'t wearing a jacket. Some cishet guys in a black Audi were driving in the opposite direction. They seemed high or drunk. Upon seeing me, they made a dangerous U-turn, stopping close to the sidewalk where I was walking. They rolled down the passenger window and started laughing and asking my rate/hour and why I was walking alone at night. They drove by me for about 3 minutes, Keizer Karelstraat is long. I was very anxious and sobered up immediately. I started filming the ground as I was scared they were going to open their passenger door and drag me with them. I didn\'t respond to their yelling and their responses quickly escalated from \'flirty\' to hateful remarks about my appearance and how black women are the scum of the earth. They yelled at me that I was an \'ugly nigger bitch\' and \'that I would be lucky if someone would rape me\'. At some point they got annoyed at my indifference I guess and drove away really fast.
data.title: verbal harassment

data.description: Reacted to someone who was catcalling me, they got mad and spit in my face

Was walking to class, a (drunk) man walked behind me. He tapped me on the shoulder and as I turned around he grabbed my breasts. I headbutted him and started shouting. A woman came out of her house to see what was going on. She called the cops. The three of us waited. The man with a smug face. When the cops arrived, they were friendly up until the point they realised the woman didn\'t see anything happen, she only heard me scream. Then they changed the narrative and became condescending towards me. The man denied everything. They asked me \"What do you want us to do, madammeke?\" and even went as far to say that I was lucky the man didn\'t report me because the only thing the could physically see was that I headbumped him. They made no record of whatever happened. We all just walked away. They pretty much just laughed in my face.
A man who was catcalling me threatened to rape me when I yelled back. I started yelling at him. He threw his fist in my stomach. I pushed him over. It was really painful.
data.title: Gentse Feesten

data.description:
thursday night 27th of august and friday morning 28th of august, the following happened to me and my friend in berlin: around 2 am we were drinking our final beer on heinrichplatz (kreuzberg) and witnessed the police control of a black person and decided to go nearer to offer the person some social control. my friend started filming with her phone and my other friend tried but couldnÂ´t because her phone didnÂ´t have enough memory. the police tried to stop us from filming and one police officer took my friends phone and deleted the videos, the phone was given back to her. the phone of my other friend however, they wanted to confiscate because they believed she filmed something and immediately put it online. this was not the case, in fact she did not film at all. in the meantime, the police officers had called for back up and there were 8 (!) police cars in total with 16 police officers called to deal with this. my friend and me got into a discussion with the police, we told them we could show them on the phone that she did not film anything, so we could go home with the phone. they didnÂ´t accept this and really wanted to have the phone. they told me to step back, because they wanted to talk to her alone. i said i would stay by her side. all of a sudden they ripped us apart and threw me on the ground and put me in handcuffs behind my back. my other friend was filming everything, but the police tried to block the camera and shine their lights into it. they took her phone and put me against the car. i was yelling to my other friend on the other side of the street and the police officer told me that i could only speak german so they could understand (my friend doesnÂ´t understand german), i ignored this order and continued to speak in dutch. the police officer said to her colleague that i was annoying and that she wanted to put me in the car and take me with them. i was put in the car with a police officer guarding me. meanwhile, 8 police cars with sirens were blocking the whole street for this Â´incident.

in the car i started crying and they began to mock me -sheÂ´s a cry baby- or -what the hell is wrong with her- and laughing at me. they took me to Polizeidirektion Abschnitt 5 in Friedrichshain. when we arrived they put me on a chair still handcuffed. it was around 3 am now. my crying became a panic attack and the police officers started mocking me even more. they took me to another room where the policeman who arrested me was typing out the case. i asked to read the statement and make my own statement but they never let me read anything, they never took my statement. when i asked why i was arrested, they told me it was because of -Versuchte KÃ¶rperverletzung von Polizisten und Widerstand gegen Vollstreckungsbeamte- so they said i tried to hurt police officers and resisting police. ofcourse i was the one that was hurt: my head and the whole left side of my body hit the ground when they threw me on the floor, my knees where hurt when they turned me around and pressed me on the floor. 

because i donÂ´t live in berlin (i live in belgium), they could not let me go, they said, there  was a danger that i would Â´runÂ´. so they decided they would put me in a cell. around 8 am they took me to LKA Berlin (Landeskriminalamt Berlin) at tempelhof to the department 5, for terrorists and people that commit severe felonies such as sex crimes and abduction etc. on my arrival there they treated me like a dog. i was still crying and they were humiliating me even more. two women took me to a very small room where they left me for a while (i was having a second panic attack here). they came back and told me to take off my clothes, they took my belongings, looked at my whole body and humiliated me by looking if i had hidden something in my ass or vagina. when they saw i had a tampon, they told me to put my clothes back on. my pullover and jacket were taken, they promised they would give me a pullover (which they never did). other police officers took me to a tiny stinking cell with a `bedÂ´ made out of wooden planks impossible to sleep on. they left me there for another 4 hours. i was thirsty and cold, since 2 am they refused to give me water and they refused to give me something to wear or a blanket. 

around 12 am on friday, they took me out of the cell, took fingerprints, made mugshots, documented all the details of my looks and gave me back my belongings. i asked why they put me in the cell, why they arrested me and if i could see the statement they made. they said if i want to know anything or see any document i have to get a lawyer and they threw me out.
data.title: Police violence

data.description:
My girlfriend used to live nearby. We often got catcalled here and generally didn\'t feel safe a lot of the time. 
One time it got really bad:
A car with 5 rowdy men drove by when we were walking home in the evening. They stopped a few meters away from us and started catcalling and shouting obsceneties.
I got mad and slightly overconfident and showed them my middle finger when we got a bit further away from them (they were still harassing us from afar) - after which they promptly made a dangerous U-turn in our direction. Obviously this was a very scary and dangerous situation, luckily it was right near the flat building of my partner so we got in safely and never saw them again.
data.title: Car with 5 men harassing and following us

data.description:
My friend and a buddy of him got surrounded by a few men at night who started out friendly but became increasingly more touching, harassing and creepy. 
Luckily my friend - who has been the victim of similar gay bashing or violence before - reacted quickly by grabbing his bud by the arm into the night shop nearby. 
The men at the night shop were very understanding and blocked the door and waited until the harassers left, after which one of the night shop men walked my friend and his buddy home to make sure they were safe (luckily it was only a block away).

Luckily she got out safely, found us and explained us everything. She was obviously shook and went home, where she promptly passed out and got found by her mother. 

She had explained to me what the dude had looked like, so I was already furious and on high alert (didn\'t know about the drugging part yet, was still at said party) - not much later I felt someone randomly grab my ass. I turned around and saw that this dude completely fit the description. 
I got all up in his face yelling at him (overprotectiveness over a friend + alcohol will make me disregard my own safety sometimes). He started yelling back, he was a very buff and toxic dude, I almost hit him and my friend had to drag me away. 

When \"cooling down\" in the girl\'s bathroom, a random girl came up to me and told me \"I know this dude. He\'s very dangerous. Stay away from him.\"

Didn\'t see him after that, and we were all obviously very shook about all the events of that evening.

Het was vorig jaar tijdens de juli examens. Ik studeerde de dag voor mijn examen thuis en nam diezelfde avond nog de trein naar mijn kot in Gent. Op een of andere reden had ik de verkeerde tram genomen die helemaal uit de studentenbuurt reedt, waardoor ik afstapte en besloot te voet naar kot te gaan. Het was al vrij laat (12u) en ik liep door een steegje totaal niet wetende waar ik me juist bevond, mijn gsm was ondertussen uitgevallen, dus kon ook niet even mijn gps instellen. En ik zag een groepje jongens op de stoep lopen in mijn richting, ik zag dat het jongens waren met andere roots en de blm was heel fel aan het opkomen waardoor ik dacht van kom steek de straat niet over, je wil hun niet het gevoel geven dat de racist bent. Dus liep ik gewoon door en zei vriendelijk goedenavond, tot ze tegen me begonnen lopen/duwen en me begonnen uit te schelden. Ik had zo veel bang omdat ik niet wist waar ik was, het beire donker was en had geen gsm. 
Daarnaast ben ik ook al enkele keren vulgair aangesproken geweest wanneer ik in de ochtend na een nachtje ovp, van mijn vriend zijn kot terug naar mijn ging. Ik had nog lippenstift op en iemand zei â€˜ewa vuile kechâ€™ So yeah (even ter verduidelijking ik hou van diversiteit en in contact komen met andere culturen, wilde gewoon even vermelden dat het mensen met andere roots waren zodat jullie weten waarom ik de straat niet heb over gestoken)

Ik probeerde steeds zo kort mogelijk te antwoorden. \"Ik vroeg mij af of jij eens met mij op date zou willen\", zei hij. Een \"nee, danku\" was blijkbaar niet genoeg. Hij zei nog wat en toen vroeg hij dat dat was omdat ik een vriend had. Ik zei maar snel van wel en zei dat die binnen in de bank was. Dat was de enige manier waarop ik hem kon afwijzen, anders had hij gewoon doorgegaan. Ik was 16, hij was ouder dan 35.
data.title: Lastiggevallen door man van +35

data.description: Ik ging lopen met mijn vriend. Ik was moe en rustte uit op het bankje aan het water, hij liep een eindje verder en ging later terugkomen. Ik zat nog geen twee minuten neer toen er een klein 5-jarig meisje op mij afstapte, ze kwam zeggen dat haar nonkel mij echt een mooi meisje vond. Ik lachte awkward-vriendelijk naar de nonkel, het was ten slotte ook nog maar zo een jong meisje en wou het niet nog vreemder maken. Toen ze een paar meter stapte stuurde hij zijn tweede nichtje om te vragen of hij mijn nummer zou mogen hebben omdat hij mij graag nog eens zou zien omdat ik er zo mooi uitzag. Ik had instant spijt dat ik mijn loopshort aanhad ipv mijn lange joggingsbroek. Had ik ook maar mijn lange mouwen tshirt aan gehad ipv die korte. Ik wist niet wat te zeggen en wimpelde het kindje vriendelijk af, geheel gedegouteerd. Een derde keer kwaam hij toch nog eens vragen en wist ik zelfs niet waat zeggen, ik ben gewoon weggestapt. Ik kon geen woord meer zeggen, ik stond helemaal perplex. Hoe kon je je eigen nichtjes zoiets laten vragen, hoe kan je die kleine meisjes aanleren dat dit gewoon normaal is, hoe kan hij zo onrespectvol zijn tov zijn nichtejes maar ook tov een rustende jogger die niets vraagt en drie keer NEEN zegt?! Zo snel als ik kon liep ik mijn vriend zijn richting uit en eens aangekomen begon ik tranen met tuiten te huilen. Tot op de dag van vandaag begrijp ik nog altijd niet wat die man bezielde, en ben ik nog steeds erg bezorgd over zijn 2 kleine nichtjes...

data.description:
Mijn verhaal gaat over twee jaar geleden, maar het liet echt een litteken voor me achter en ik hoop dat jullie mijn verhaal begrijpen. En het een gelijke kans willen geven als de daden die op de dag of week zelf gebeuren.
In het verleden was er al het ene en het andere gebeurt tussen mijn beste vriend en ik waar ik het al dan niet mee eens was. maar na het leren kennen van mijn vriend had ik duidelijk aangeggeven dat de â€˜spelletjesâ€™ die zich afspeelden tussen mijn beste vriend en ik gedaan moesten zijn. Dit verliep doorheen de tijd wat op en af maar opzich viel het allemaal gezien naar het gehele plaatje nog wel mee. Twee jaar later lokte hij me naar het lokaal, in eerste instantie ging hij na of ik aan anticonceptie deed en soa vrij was. Dit deed hij aan de hand van een gesprek ivm de relatie die hij met zijn vriendin had. Het leek of hij me in een zwakke situatie probeerde te stoppen door bepaalde gesprekken aan te halen. vervolgens probeerde hij me te manipuleren door te zeggen dat het allemaal oke is en het zogezegd te weten dat ik meer van hem wou en de aanrakingen miste van hem. Na meerdere malen te zeggen dat ik niets van hem moest begon ik stillaan te beseffen dat ik er niet zomaar onderuit ging komen. Ik wist niet meer wat ik moest doen en kwam in de zogehete â€˜freezing-faseâ€™ terecht. Dit maakte dat hij met mijn lichaam kon doen wat hij zelf begeerde. Ondertussen is het bijna twee jaar na de feiten en zijn er nog steeds geen oplossingen gevonden voor het probleem mits geen bewijs. Het duurd nu al van augustus dat ik strijd voor mijn plek in de groep terug te krijgen terwijl ik meerder traumaâ€™s heb moeten verwerken. Ondanks de stappen die ik al ondernomen heb, blijf ik nog steeds achter met het gevoel dat het allemaal taboe is. Maar ik zit er behoorlijk mee.
Het doel dat ik hiermee hoop te bereiken is dat mensen er toch een keer bij stil kunnen staan dat het ook in een parkt achter de muren kan gebeuren van een club waar iedereen bevriend zou moeten zijn met elkaar. Dat het wel degelijk Echt over een speeltuin kan afspelen. En hoewel mijn verhaal binnen in mijn club nog niet erg gekend is en alles nog achter de doeken gehouden word hoop ik hier een kleine zet mee te geven dat ik het stilaan beu ben om niet opgemerkt te worden als slachtoffer binnen mijn eigen club. Maar dan voor mij nog op een moment dat ik het toch nog stiekem en rustig aan kan aanpakken.
De meest ideale situatie voor mij zou zijn dat de zin geplaatst word voor de deur van het powerlokaal van de atletiek club olse merksen. (als dit mag uiteraard)
Ik hoop dat jullie dit voor mij willen doen, Ik denk dat dit voormezelf een geoote stap is en het zou erg veel voor me betekenen.
Dank jullie wel!
data.title: rape by a best freind

data.description: Op zondagavond was ik opweg naar mijn kot in Merelbeke. Ik kwam net van de trein uit Antwerpen en moest wachten aan een van de perrons van het Gent-Sint-Pieters station. Het duurt nog ongeveer een kwartier voor mijn bus er is wanneer een man naar me toe gelopen komt. Omdat ik altijd vriendelijk wil zijn glimlach ik terwijl de man naar me toe komt. Hij vraagt welke bus hij moet nemen om naar Ledeberg te gaan. Ik zeg dat ik het niet weet maar zoek het even voor hem op. Ik geef hem de nodige info maar hij blijft gewoon staan. Vanaf dit moment wordt het erg ongemakkelijk. Hij zegt hoe mooi ik ben, vraagt of ik een lief heb. Wanneer ik zeg dat ik er een heb lacht hij en vraagt of hij niet mijn tweede lief mag zijn. Hij vraagt waar ik naartoe ga, wat mijn naam is, of hij mee mag... Ik sta helemaal alleen, niemand in de buurt om me te helpen. Ik bel mijn vriend om een reden te hebben van het gesprek weg te gaan. Wanneer mijn bus eindelijk arriveert wandelt de man weg. Op aanraden van mijn vriend heb ik op de bus meteen de politie gebeld.
data.title: Wachten op de bus als een vogel voor de kat

data.description:
I was walking down the street and a guy catcalled me when we crossed paths. I confronted him with a small head tilt, kind of like saying \'what\'s up?\'. He ignored me and kept walking.
I shrugged it off, continued my route and went into a store. When I came out 15 minutes later, the guy was waiting for me at the entrance of the store. He had followed me there.
He stood very close to me and asked in an aggressive way if we had a problem. I realized that he was threatening to fight me if I said yes. I acted like I didn\'t know what he was talking about and left. I cried after because I felt unsafe and oppressed.

Over the years on I\'ve been whistled at, howled at and catcalled. I\'ve been grabbed, groped and cornered.
I\'ve been called an \"ugly bitch\" for not responding to sexual advances.
I\'ve seen and heard of this happening to most of my female friends. I\'ve heard of worse things that have happened.
This so much bigger than we think and we need to stop minimizing it. We need to stop thinking it\'s not that bad and it\'s just a part of life.
data.title: Whistled at, howled at and catcalled, grabbed, groped and cornered.

Toen ik zondagavond op de trein naar Antwerpen zat, kwam er een man in mijn wagon zitten. We moesten nog Ã©Ã©n halte verder en de trein was zo goed als leeg. De conductrice was in Berchem afgestapt en had me nog verteld dat we echt met weinig waren en dat de volgende reiziger zelfs twee wagons verder zat. In Berchem stapte Ã©Ã©n man dus op en die kwam in mijn wagon zitten. Schuins over mij terwijl de gehele wagon leeg was. Ik schonk niet zoveel aandacht aan hem aangezien ik een interessante podcast aan het luisteren was. Na een tijd begon hij te praten tegen mij, uit beleefdheid deed ik mijn oortjes uit want ik had geen idee wat hij zonet had gezegd. Hij vroeg mij van alle vragen waar ik kort op antwoorde zoals mijn leeftijd, waarom ik naar antwerpen ging, of ik niet met hem iets mee wou gaan doen. Op die laatste vraag antwoorde ik \'nee\' hierna begon hij verschillende seksuele handelingen te vermelden. Wat hij leuk vond, wat hij al had gedaan, waar hij volgens hem goed in was,.....

data.description:
I (18)went drinking with my studentclub in the park. Around 10:00 pm everyone was heading home. A guy (25) asked me if he and 2 others (another boy and a girl) could come to my dorm and have a drink. I said it was okay. I went ahead so I could clean my dorm a bit before they arrived. 
Around 10:30 pm  I get a call of him, he said \"WE arrived\". I open my door and it is just him. I don\'t think there was ever a plan that the others would come. I don\'t make a fuss and let him in. It was a really fun evening. At one time he touched my thigh and started \"stroking\" it. I didn\'t say anything but just moved my leg. He got the hint, so he stopped. I know he lives very close (max. 5 minutes). 
Around 11:30 pm I tell him that he should probably leave because of the covid-curfew.
He answers \"sure, just after this song\". After the song he says \"I\'ll just go to the toilet real quick\". When he gets back it\'s 11:38 pm (I checked). I said \"okay byeeee\". And than he starts arguing that he would like to stay longer. I said \"okay just leave in time\". At 11:50 pm I tell him to leave  \"oh now I can\'t go anymore it\'s too late\". I argued a lot with him cause I didn\'t want him to sleep over. I literally said \"I don\'t want you to stay any longer, please leave now\". He just laughed it all away and kept saying \"please, I won\'t do anything, we would just sleep\". I had to call one of my friends at my dorm to come and argue with me till he left. I was so scared. Without my friend, he wouldn\'t have left at all. I really thought that he was gonna stay no matter what, and who know what would have happened that night. but I am sure that it would not have been fun for me...
data.title: \"No\" does not mean \"argue with me till I say yes\"

data.description:
This event occurred to me on the 13th of June 2021 around 1 am in the morning. I was walking home after the soccer game (Belgium v. Russia) with another female friend. We were heading to my studio in Vlamingenstraat. An unknown man (white and blonde) approached us and asked where we were from. We answered we were not interested in talking to him. However, he acted aggressively handling a plastic stick ( those to support the soccer team). He moved around us and hit me from behind on my ass with this plastic stick. I immediately reacted and told him I was going to call the police if he did not leave. I took out my cellphone, but he did not care and kept harassing us. At the intersection of the Carrefour Express, he joined another group of people and we thought we would stop. Instead of that, he came back to us to continue harassing us. I asked a man in a bike that was passing by and two more girls that were in a group around to help us. He felt intimidated and ran away. 
Then I went to the Police to make a complaint. Apparently, currently, there is not a specific protocol to attend to victims of this kind of violence. As a woman from Latinamerica that came to this country to study, I do not feel safe anymore in the streets of Leuven. Being drunk is not a justification for this kind of aggression. Any woman should ever be harassed in a public space.
data.title: Sexual harrasment

I answered politely, but he didn\'t understand and asked again. I answered again, assuming he didn\'t know the language, since he had a raw accent. I told him the time again, but then he asked the same question while looking down. When I looked down I saw his zipper was open and he was holding his penis with his right hand. I immediately walked away, got in my car en locked the doors. I immediately called my friend to tell her what had happened, but when doing so, the man passed my car again and signalled \'it\'s okay, don\'t worry\'. I then started my car and got out of there as quickly as possible. I was shaking the entire way back home. data.description:
Meisjes mogen toch ook drinken? 
Een \'kennis\' van op het skatepark wou mij na een avondje drinken in het park naar huis begeleiden. Ik had veel gedronken maar ik vermoed dat iemand mijn drankje gespiket had. De kerel kwam binnen en maakte goed gebruik van de situatie. Ik werd verdwaasd wakker in mijn bed. Overal bloed. In de badkamer, op het bed, op de vloer, ook op het hoofdkussen dat hij onder me geschoven had, omdat ik duidelijk niet kon meewerken. Ik deed aangifte bij de politie, maar daar kon ik niet op veel hulp rekenen. â€œGeen getuigenâ€, â€œonvoldoende bewijsâ€. Nadien maakte de dader een groepschat en hebben die heren onderling eens besproken wat ze konden doen om hem te helpen. Genieten achteraf, wanneer ik te weten kwam dat de helft van de Gentse skatescene wist wat er met mij gebeurd was en mij niet gelooft, of sterker nog: de kant van mijn verkrachter kiest. De jongens in kwestie: 1 werkt bij VZW Jong als jeugdbegeleider, 1 publiceerde onlangs een boek met mentale gezondheid als sleutelonderwerp, nog 1 heeft een aantal skateshops in Vlaanderen, de rest bekende skaters. Ja, deze lieve jongens nemen het graag op voor hun maatje. Besef wat zij gedaan hebben, waar zij aan meewerken! En maar beweren dat vrouwen veilig zijn op het skatepark. â€œGirl-eventsâ€ organiseren, nee dankjewel! Ik griezel hiervan. Dit heeft mijn vertrouwen in mannen ernstig aangetast. Mijn gevoel op een skatepark zal nooit meer hetzelfde zijn. Nog een dader die zijn handjes mag kussen. Laat dit niet gebeuren. Speak up. & Boys, do right by the women in your life.
data.title: Hij wou mij \'naar huis brengen\'.

data.description: While walking home from a friend\'s house around 12 a.m., I was groped on an empty street. When I removed his arm from my body, he just put his arm back and grabbed my ass this time too. I quickly walked away on autopilot and he went to discuss the situation with his friend who apparently was walking across the street. Because I was appalled by how a \'good evening\' had escalated into a totally unwanted grope, I gathered all my courage to address him with his friend and point out how fucked up this was, hoping he would understand, apologise and learn something. But his only answer was: \'Saying \'good night\' back to me, means I can grab you like this, right?\'. He apparently was very aware of the situation and genuinely believed that my response meant consent. The confirmation of this distorted view about flirting with women shocked me the most. It felt completely robbed of my agency, like my body wasn\'t mine anymore only because I talked back to him.

Na een avond te spenderen op het appartement van vrienden ging ik met mijn fiets naar huis. Aan het Koophandelsplein in Gent stopte ik aan een zebrapad om enkele personen over te laten. Een persoon hield me tegen en pakte me vast. Hij betastte me over m\'n hele lichaam terwijl z\'n vrienden erbij stonden te kijken. Er werd voortdurend herhaald dat hij sex wilde. Er waren weinig mensen op straat, want het was laat + werkweek. Plots merkten ze op dat er iemand (een voetganger) op ongeveer 50 meter op de hoek van de Zonnestraat stond toe te kijken. De volgende dag ging ik naar het politiekantoor. Ik deed mijn verhaal en dit werd in een formulier ingevuld. Mijn gevoel (schaamte? Angst?) werd helemaal niet serieus genomen. Er was geen warmte, geen menselijkheid. Gewoon een agent, twee stoelen een tafel en een conputer. We werden voortdurend gestoord. Vertelde me dat hij niet goed wist onder welke titel hij het formulier moest opslaan. Ik liep naar buiten met het gevoel dat ik overdreef. Dat er veel ergere situaties zijn waarmee agenten zich moeten bezighouden en ik me er niet druk in moest maken.

data.description: Na een avond Zesdaagse met vrienden nog naar Cafe Molotov getrokken. We hadden al best wat gedronken, maar ik was nog bij m\'n verstand. Ik herinner me dat ik stond te dansen en me ineens heel raar voelde. Daarna is alles volledig blank tot de volgende dag. Vrienden waren me kwijt, wisten niet waar ik was. Ik werd de volgende ochtend naakt wakker in een huis dat ik niet kende naast \'n man die ik niet kende, nooit had gezien. Ik voelde aan mijn lijf dat ik seks had gehad, maar kon me niets herinneren. De man praatte totaal niet tegen mij. Deed alsof ik er niet was. Ik ben beschaamd gevlucht. Ben naar huis gewandeld. Herinner me daar ook heel weinig van. Weet niet meer waar dat huis was. De rest van het weekend ben ik veel stukken kwijt. Nog nooit zo een zwart gat gehad. Alles blijft weg. Ik heb het niemand verteld en volledig verdrongen, tot het vorig jaar plots bovenkwam. Elke keer het terugkomt, voel ik me volledig in elkaar krimpen. Moet ik (bijna) huilen. Ik heb al one night stands gehad, nooit spijt gehad over zo een nacht, nooit verdrongen. Dit voelt zo anders. Sinds een paar maanden durf ik toegeven wat mijn lijf mij al die tijd probeert te vertellen: ik wou dat niet toen. Ik voel me nog altijd schuldig. Heb nooit aangifte gedaan. Ik durf niet. Ik voel me misbruikt. Maar ik ga vooral nooit weten wat er is gebeurd. Sinds kort weet ik dat ik in die staat onmogelijk kon toestemming geven. Dat maakt het sowieso verkrachting. data.description: A guy on a bike crossed me, decided to stop and started walking alongside me. He kept trying to lure me into dark, hidden places. I kept rejecting him, he kept walking beside me for some 20 minutes until I reached my house. He tried to force his way in but I managed to get in without him.
Cycling my way home after a school dance at 6 in the morning, a car with 4 guys started driving slowly alongside me. They made sexist comments for about 3 minutes until they got bored.

We were enjoying some beers with a few friends in their scouts. He kept on asking me to go to his place. I kept saying no. He grabbed and kissed me. I pushed him away and again told him off. Two of his friends took him away from me. He said he understood \'No means no, I know\". He didn\'t. He followed me on my bike home. He suddenly stopped his bike in front of me, blocking my way. Holding my bike and pulled it so I fell onto him. He demanded me to come with him or he would come to my place. I was living with my parents who I didn\'t want to see me drunk with a guy like this during corona time. I said it would be a small quiet night out, it escalated. He said we could just sleep, in an error of not thinking but feeling that this was a way to de-escalate the situation I went with him. I almost fell asleep and felt him on top of me. I told him to stop but he made himself heavier and continued to go deeper into me. Pushing his body weight on me. I was so tired, didn\'t get answers anymore, didn\'t know what to do. I asked him to at least were a condom. He said no. When he fell asleep I got up as soon as I felt I could and left. I showered for hours the day after. It took me almost a year to shift more of the blame on him than on me. I don\'t feel my body is my own. I can\'t look at it most days. I still feel a lot of shame, also when I see mutual friends. I haven\'t been able to return.

data.description: I was raped by a famous artist that gets praised for his socially engaged art, allyship and decolonization work. This happened in an apartment that NTGent gives to artists to sleep in when they come to Ghent. I made clear I didnâ€™t want to be touched in any way over and over again, with words and with my body. It started with trying to touch or kiss me, I didnâ€™t expect him to go further. I somehow trusted him (since it was not the first time we met). But he kept on touching me until the point where I could not defend myself anymore, I froze and he did not stop until he â€œfinishedâ€. I remember it took forever. I remember not being able to move for a while, but then managing to get up, get dressed and leave the house. I felt weak and ashamed towards myself for not being able to fight him. (Also: I was 20 and he was 50). I never told anyone. I pretend it did not happen, tried to suppress the memory but now and then I got triggered by something that reminds me of the evening or of him and I panic or get very anxious. Sometimes I doubt to tell someone, or want to break his power / fame, but I donâ€™t want to give this person my energy, donâ€™t want to experience the disbelief or reactions from his huge network, I donâ€™t want to experience and relive this evening over and over again by exposing him. Aangezien ik de volgende dag les had om 8u30 besloot ik om hierna naar huis te gaan voor me te kunnen opfrissen. Ik was 17 en had behoorlijk wat gedronken. Op de kick-off raakte ik mijn vriendin kwijt waardoor ik besloot door te gaan ondanks mijn toestand. Ik wou de tram nemen aan de Nederkouter maar werd aangesproken door een man rond de 30 die me dwingend mee vroeg met hem. Ik had de macht niet om me te verdedigen. Hij hield me vast en wist niet wat me overkwam aangezien ik niet bewust meer kon nadenken. Hij zag dat ik kwetsbaar was en daar was hij juist naar opzoek. Hij woonde ietsje verder in de straat. Ik herinner niet veel meer maar weet dat hij me op zijn bed gooide, mijn kleren uittrok en zijn hand op mijn mond legde omdat ik begon te roepen wanneer hij me penetreerde. Door de drank viel ik hierna inslaap tot ik wakker werd met hem die me penetreerde. Ik wist niet waar ik was en wat er gebeurd was. Ik schoot recht, deed mijn kleren aan en moest vertrekken naar school. Ik was 17 en heb dit nooit durven vertellen aan iemand.
data.title: Meegesleurd door man na Student Kickoff

data.description: (2017) going home by bike after night out. A Car passed me, aggressively (with a recognisable engine sound). I wasn\'t the only one still out on the streets. Suddenly I hear the same car nearing again behind me (so they must have taken the roundabout). They slow down and tried to grab my attention. The guys seemed under influence. They asked me the way. I refused and started biking again. After a minute or two biking they were again next to me asking me the same question, trying to slow me down (not giving me a lot of room for biking). I was alarmed by the fact that they did not care to ask the other few people still on the streets. They kept on asking and asking me to stop biking. Only by keeping my cool and saying confidently that I was expected somewhere in 7 minutes or so they left me alone, driving by aggressively again. Scared me quite a bit.

data.description:
It\'s a while ago, i was walking back from a friend who lived in home fabiola to my place after a school project. I had a drink or two but mostly i was very tired.  The overpoort was crowded and there was police at the beginning of the street.  However, they were more talking to each other than checking for shady situations and anticipation on them.  As soon as I exited the Overpoort I realised i was followed.  Being tought that I should\'nt exagerate, that\'s what I did, so I ignored it.  When the other persons on the street went their way, I found myself alone on the streed with only the follower behind me.  Still ignoring this.  Suddenly I felt a knife in my back.  He only mentioned that I shouldn\'t be afraid because it was not my money that he was after...
A few moments and 100 m further I managed to get away and he walked back to the Overpoort.  Since then, 15 years ago, I am still afraid walking outside when it\'s dark.

data.description: Something that is still haunting me, till this day. When I walk by I try to cross the street. Because I\'m too scared to be seen and I feel humiliated till this day. During the first lockdown, in April I was desperately looking for a job to make some money. The ice-cream salon Damass was one of the first things that was allowed to open up again. I did my interview and got accepted very quick, immediately actually. He was very happy to have found a \"good looking, clean girl\". I was excited to start my job. Next day I came for a test drive. He told me I could only wear black tight pants. (Which I don\'t have because I know I like to hide my curves in baggy clothes and don\'t feel good in tighter clothes. This also because of previous catcallings, and rude cis-hetero/toxic masculinity) So I was like, okay. It started with questions like, what do you do when you go home. Where do you live. Do you like it when men make the first move, etc... I was not seeing any harm so like a.dumb naÃ¯ve girl I answered his questions and stayed friendly and smiley. After 3 days of working there, we were alone, closing the shop. He put on some music and asked me if I liked it. I was like, yeah, that\'s okay, it doesn\'t matter really? He came very close everytime I stood next to him. Started feeling uncomfortable, and I know he felt that. Starting putting his hand on my shoulder. Asking if I would date an older guy. And asking if I could guess his age. He didn\'t talk a lot about his private life, but pushed and kept asking about mine. Things went on, he kept on winking, making charming jokes (which make me smile if I think about it Fack) he told me he wanted to show me the basement. And I was like, fucked up we \'re alone, nobody here, the doors closed, windows covered. So I was like, just say yes help him with the garbage and just tell him you need to be at home because your friend is waiting. So I did and was like very quick upstairs again. He was bragging and showing tha whole basement, because it was all his property.. we went up again, came in the kitchen and got very close to me, I was blocked by his stupid big ice cream machine behind me. And I was literally thinking about just punching him in the face, he was like 1 cm from my face and smiling. I went under his arm and told him I really needed to go. He persisted and was like, don\'t be afraid I don\'t have any camera\'s at the back and at my desk. Nobody can see us. I was grabbing my stuff from the chair, where he pushed me on his desk opened my legs and starting touching me. I was shocked could not move, I could start crying, because I was just not doing anything. Me the one who\'s always fighting, shouting for every womxn, me as a freaking feminist, me as someone who would always tell my friends pls don\'t let this ever happen to you... Okay, so I pushed him away from me took my shit and told him I really needed to go and it wasn\'t correct and felt weird because he actually had a girlfriend. He laughed it away and told me, nobody will know. At least if you don\'t tell anybody. I walked outside, but we still had to pass through the back, the garage and I was putting on my jacket real quick. He blocked my way, before I could open the big fence (Hoogpoort). He leaned forward and kissed me pushed his gross fucking old man tongue in my mouth. I ran away, I was terrified, could start puking in the street, I started calling my friends to ask them I could pass by their house. I felt so sick, was looking behind me the whole time I was walking to make sure nobody followed me. I broke down, my friends told me to never go back and to text him that I felt very uncomfortable about what happened. I cried, I felt disgusted about myself. He was first. He texted something very disgusting on WhatsApp. It was something like: your lips were so soft, I enjoyed it. I\'m so sick at this moment. And I feel I\'m still not ready to say this at loud. But I took screenshot\'s, my friends were there to make sure I was not freaking out, to see everything what was happening. They helped me to send a text message, to say that I\'m not coming back and I can not come tomorrow. He hated that. He was like: I need you, you can not do this. You need to be there tomorrow because otherwise I will have to close the shop. And that would be because of you. We can talk about what happened. I was like, no I\'m not coming tomorrow. He was definitely not amused. After one week his stupid girlfriend texted me and was like, hi Yasmine I heard from Sven (the stupid guy) that you tried kissing him and that\'s why you\'re not going to work anymore. Like what the Fack?? Does it make sense woman? Like I was shooked, a woman accusing an other woman of unappropriat behaviour. But I started a conversation with her. And tried explaining but whatever. Never worked out. The reason why I\'m doing this is because yesterday I went to eat something and the freaking assaulter was in the same restaurant, I freezed, I blocked and I wanted to hide myself. data.description: Het is al lang geleden maar toch wil ik het kwijt. Het gebeurde in het 3e middelbaar. Ik zat met vriendinnen op een bankje op de speelplaats. Enkele jaren geleden bij het binnengaan in de Charlatan door de buitenwipper op de hand gekust terwijl hij er de toegangsstempel opzette. Toen ik aan het einde van de nacht de Charlatan verliet door het gangetje, zat diezelfde buitenwipper daar en drukte hij me tegen hem aan, raakte me opgepast aan en kuste mijn nek.
